summary: This document outlines the Bureau of Prisons' policies and procedures for suicide watch and psychology observation of inmates. It details the different levels of monitoring, items provided, and staff involvement for inmates deemed suicidal versus those under mental health observation.
keyFacts: The document defines two distinct inmate statuses: Suicide Watch and Psychology Observation.
Inmates on Suicide Watch are determined to be suicidal, wear special smocks and slippers, use a paper spoon, and are monitored 24/7 by inmate companions or staff.

Inmates on Psychology Observation are not deemed suicidal but may have mental health concerns; they wear standard uniforms, use regular spoons, and may have additional privileges like books and writing materials.
Psychology staff must see inmates under either status at least once per day.
Legal visits for inmates on Suicide Watch are determined on an individual basis.
